topic.title: Using mmaccess to enable write permissions

body.p: The Windows Server distribution includes the ’mmaccess.exe’ command line utility which provides a convenient method for enabling write access for the runAs user to files and folders: use the command mmaccess -h to display the following usage information:

p.codeblock:
Usage: mmaccess [-dir dirname] [-user username] [-y] [-remove]
Grant or remove mmServer runAs user access permission for folder
Options: -dir dirname specify folder name default is current working directory [C:/ap/dita-oti/samples] -file filename specify file name -user username specify username default is mmServer runAs user [.\mmUser] -y apply changes without prompting -allowadmin allow access permission addition to apply to administrator user [VERY DANGEROUS] -remove remove all access permissions previously granted to user
